node.title: Drones get in the way at large fire near Treble Cone
node.description: Firefighters and helicopter crews are fighting a large fire south of Lake WƒÅnaka near Treble Cone, and warn drone pilots are putting them at risk.
node.content:
["Firefighters and helicopter crews are fighting a large fire south of Lake Wānaka near Treble Cone, and warn drone pilots are putting them at risk.", "", "
(File photo). Photo: 123RF
", "Emergency services were called to the fire on the side of Wānaka Mt Aspiring Road at Glendhu Bay about 1.30pm today.", "In a statement Fire and Emergency NZ said the blaze is burning through vegetation and now reaches about 1km long and about 100m wide.", "Fire crews from Wānaka, Dunstan, Luggate and Arrowtown are at the fire, supported by helicopter crews.", "To keep the teams safe, the agency warned anyone operating drones in the area must ground them immediately.", ""There have been reports of drones operating near the fire, this is exceptionally dangerous with helicopters in the air and they need to be ground immediately."", "The fire has jumped Wānaka Mt Aspiring Road, which has been closed, and is burning between that road and Treble Cone Skifield Road."]
